function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"The use of de-spatialization and spatialization in pandemic control may lead to a misunderstanding of the objectives and strategies in disease prevention.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Automation and use of driverless vehicles and robots may lead to a reduction in the availability of human resources for pandemic prevention and control.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited adoption and application of 5g technology due to challenges in network structure and lack of application scenarios.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate attention to 5g’s social and business values due to focus on technological aspects and lack of commercial usage.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mental health impact during lockdown","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate research and production of test toolkits for disease detection","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complexity of social systems making lockdown implementation difficult","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in controlling sporadic outbreaks in well-controlled areas","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lagging development of vaccines and medicine","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited use of 5g technology","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependency on combination of digital technologies for epidemic prevention","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential misinformation about the role of 5g in covid-19 prevention and control.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on 5g technology may lead to neglect of other important preventive measures.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited accessibility to 5g technology may exacerbate existing health disparities.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative psychological effects and mental health impacts of prolonged lockdown measures","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the impact of built environment on mental health","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited evidence and diverse research findings","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Large sample survey during covid-19 lockdown","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Anonymity and confidentiality in survey","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mental health impact assessment","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The assessment contains questions about anxiety symptoms and severity, insomnia severity, and impulsivity levels, which may indicate mental health risks.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of poor indoor quality including natural lighting, acoustic comfort, thermo-hygrometric comfort, and privacy during phone calls","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of high depressive symptoms among students","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Association between architectural parameters and depressive symptoms","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation due to a large number of students in a shared environment.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor housing conditions contributing to moderate-severe and severe depressive symptoms in students","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative psychological effects of quarantine during infectious disease outbreaks","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential impact of built environment on physical and mental health of individuals and community","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor housing quality and inadequate indoor facilities are related to depressive symptoms.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of natural lighting, acoustic comfort, and privacy in living quarters is associated with severe depressive symptoms.","category":"Infrastructural risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor-quality views from the apartment are linked to moderate-severe and severe depressive symptoms.","category":"Infrastructural risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Social isolation and poor housing quality impact working performance and productivity during lockdown, potentially exacerbating mental health issues.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of clear work-leisure boundaries and productivity-enhancing environment in small apartments may lead to decreased productivity and work-life imbalance.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor housing physical conditions may impact physical health and contribute to health inequalities during long-term stay-at-home periods.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliability bias in self-reporting questionnaires due to under-reporting, under-estimating, and misunderstanding of mental health issues","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitations of cross-sectional study design in determining temporal relationships between variables","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited generalizability of results due to low response rate and recruitment from a single university","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of larger and more livable living spaces facing green areas","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Centrality of welfare and housing policies in population well-being","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of research on using buildings to prevent epidemics and viruses","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate management of individual behaviors to comply with safety requirements","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changing building materials may not effectively trap the virus and stop the spread of covid-19","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of specific knowledge about the effects of covid-19 on building configurations and designs","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges in creating sustainable and energy-efficient building designs that minimize the negative impact on communities and the environment","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of inadequate infection control in healthcare facilities","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adaptability in healthcare facility design","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor hospital architecture facilitating disease spread","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation to emerging problems and urgent demands","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Climate change contributes to the global spread and redistribution of communicable infections","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate indoor environmental quality iaq in built environments can raise human exposure to viral infections such as sars-cov-2","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
